document.title: Compos(t)ing Loss: Transformation in the Telling
document.abstract: Using composting as a metaphor, this author examines the transformative potential in writing about and bearing witness to stories of loss, particularly the death of a parent.
document.publication-title: The Journal of the Assembly for Expanded Perspectives on Learning

field.name: acknowledgements
field.value: Laura Milner is an assistant professor in the Department of Writing and Linguistics at Georgia Southern University, a Zen practitioner, and a candidate for a Ph.D. in composition studies at Indiana University of Pennsylvania. Her dissertation explores the circumstances under which college students choose to write about loss and the consequences of such writing for the writer, his or her peers, and teachers.
